Summary I am graduate of the University of Michigan. I hold Bachelor of Business Administration from Michigan's Ross School of Business and a Bachelor of Arts in Economics from Michigan's College of Literature Science and the Arts. I love Entrepreneurship and Innovation. I am entering my first year at Google as an Associate Product Marketing Manager.

Forever Go Blue! Experience Associate Product Marketing Manager: Google Partners Google September 2014  – Present (1 year) Mountain View, California Associate Product Marketing Manager Intern Google June 2013  –  August 2013  (3 months) Mountain View, California I worked on the go to market strategy on a yet to be announced Google product. This included drafting 50 in product emails while working with a legal team, an editing team and an engineering team to load into product. I interviewed and compiled customer stories for the new website while creating 10 uses cases for the site as well. Meanwhile, I helped devise a marketing strategy to cross promote the new product at launch. I also worked with the recruiting team to organize a mentor/intern field day. President MPowered Entrepreneurship June 2012  –  May 2013  (1 year) Ann Arbor, Michigan I served as the President of MPowered Entrepreneurship, an 100 person large organization dedicated to exposing students to entrepreneurship and supporting student entrepreneurs. I managed a $70,000 budget split between 13 projects. In my time as President, MPowered reached new heights by impacting over 6,000 students. (1 of 8 students at U of M, and 1 of 4 undergraduate students) We broke our previous world record for most student elevator pitches received in a student competition. Meanwhile, we set a new record for creating the largest student run Hackathon, MHacks, that 500 students from around the country attended. MPowered also organized a Startup Career Fair which connected 2000 students and 100 startups. Founding Chair University of Michigan Central Student Government Entrepreneurship Commission June 2012  –  May 2013  (1 year) Ann Arbor, Michigan I founded and chaired the first ever Entrepreneurship Commission through University of Michigan's Central Student Government. I recruited for the commission which was made up of the Presidents from the 15 entrepreneurship themed student organizations around campus. We supported each other's student organizations through funding and holding the first ever Month of Entrepreneurship at Michigan. Co-Founder Magnetic Hip Startup January 2012  –  September 2012  (9 months) Ann Arbor, Michigan I co-founded a magnetic hip startup with two other students at the University of Michigan. We were interested in alleviating pain caused by obstreperous in hips. We looked at implanting rare earth magnets in a compresable material that would be surgically implanted. I worked with laywers to go through the Provisional Patent process while researching the market size and opportunities. 1000 Pitches Director MPowered Entrepreneurship March 2011  –  March 2012  (1 year 1 month) Ann Arbor, MI I worked as the 1000 Pitches Director for MPowered Entrepreneurship at the University of Michigan. 1000 Pitches is the world's largest student-run elevator pitch competition. As the director, I fundraised $40,000 while managing a team of 30 members. I organized the logistics of the 8 week competition while overseeing the judging of the pitches. As director, 1000 Pitches broke the world record with 3,331 pitches. Summary An innovative, energetic marketer with 6.5 years of experience in B2B, B2C and product marketing, with an EMEA and international focus. Passionate about the startup and developer community, serving as a an advisor to numerous start-ups.  
 
A creative storyteller with strong record of managing brands, creating impact and inspiring others. Self-starter with hands-on mentality. Highly analytical problem-solver thriving in international, challenging environments. 
 
Representing Google at external events; held a talk at the Bloomberg Innovation Summit about innovation at Google, spoke at the London School of Economics Career Fair about working at Google. 
 
Specialties: Product Marketing, Brand Management & Communications, Content Creation, Curation & Marketing, Strategic Planning, Events, Video Advertising, Mobile Advertising, SEM, Social Media, Partner Management, Strategic Partnerships. 
 
Things I am most proud of: 
- Leading the YouTube B2B marketing activity across the EMEA region 
- Being the global Marketing Lead for the Consumer Barometer in 2014. The Consumer Barometer was shortlisted in the Webby’s awards, IAB Europe Research Awards, Mediatel’s Connected Consumer Awards 
- Overseeing the Marketing & Comms of Google’s presence in 2014 Cannes Lions Festival 
- Volunteering for SEWA Bharat as part of the Google Reach Leadership Program

- Being involved  Experience Product Marketing Manager, YouTube Ads & Research Communications Google October 2013  – Present (1 year 11 months) London, United Kingdom EMEA Programme Lead - YouTube Ads  
Currently leading all YouTube Ads programmes in EMEA working cross-functionally across 17 markets, PR and LCS.  
Creating the central marketing strategy, from key objectives and mission, to customer touchpoints, product launches and resource planning

Global Product Marketing Lead - Consumer Barometer  
Led the global launch of Google's Consumer Barometer, a free tool that delivers consumer insights to support media planning and decision-making. Created go-to-market strategy and led its implementation managing stakeholders among the Market Insights, PR and country marketing teams  
One of the most successful research-related launches with record number of visitors, time-on-site and PR coverage 
 
Project Co-Lead - Google Executive Summit 
Organised an exclusive event for the CEOs of the top 45 EMEA clients ($1bn+ revenue) in partnership with Singularity University. Co-led every every aspect of the project from strategy and content curation to invitations and logistics. 
 
Project Co-Lead - WellVersed (20% role)

Summary Business professional with a varied skill set across marketing and sales. Proven track record of excelling in a fast-paced and results-oriented environment, coupled with the ability to jump seamlessly between analytical/creative marketing responsibilities and consultative sales functions. Passion for creating positive in the world through my talents, energy, and work ethic. 
 
Past: Cut my teeth from 2010 to 2013 on search, display, and video executions for Google's biggest clients - most notably in the spaces of e-commerce and omni-channel retailing. Moved to London in 2013 to work on Finance brands as they figured out branded video content on YouTube.  
 
Present: Came back stateside and moved into the prestigious APMM program, learning the client side of the business across creative, growth, and product. Focused on the launch and development of Google's gTLD strings, as well as the day-to-day management of the company's domain portfolio. Since then, I've become one of the first marketers on Google Domains, touching every aspect of the marketing mix for the new business. Moved to Google Maps marketing in April of 2015, managing all social channels as well as working on traditional product marketing.  
 
When I'm not @ the Googleplex, some consider me one of the country's most promising young magicians. I perform for an array of prestigious clients nationwide under my stage name of David Gerard. I write, direct, and produce a one-man show that has sold out for over 4 years straight in the Bay Area.

Dr. Graham's devotion to the improvement of the quality of human life continues, through generations, to inspire striving for the ideals here recognized.
